name: Kepler-346
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-346 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-346 is a star with 0.9770000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.02 times its radius. It is located 3302.07 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-346 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-346 b

Kepler-346 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.51 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-346.

The mass of Kepler-346 b is 10.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-346 b is 2.66 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-346 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-346 c

Kepler-346 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.17 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 23.85 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-346.

The mass of Kepler-346 c is 14.22 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-346 c is 3.07 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-346 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-346, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
